alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:14AM CDT until May 07 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .The Wild Rice River near Abercrombie has begun to respond to ongoing rainfall. At this time, moderate flooding impacts are forecasted. This forecast takes into account past rainfall and forecasted rainfall through 7 AM Sunday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. City begins to mobilize. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 13.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
